table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The COC File is used to specify the output desired in addition to the output written to the Listing File. For example, node heads and flow terms can be written to separate files for post processing, such as plotting and calculations. Pipe flow rates and Reynolds numbers also can be written to separate files for post processing. The COC File specifies the pipe and node numbers for output as well as the output interval. This file is only used for CFP Modes 1 and 3.

link.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.link: Shoemaker, W.B., Kuniansky, E.L., Birk, S., Bauer, S., and Swain, E.D., 2007, Documentation of a Conduit Flow Process (CFP) for MODFLOW-2005: U.S. Geological Survey Techniques and Methods, Book 6, Chapter A24, 50 p.

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: For each simulation, all variables, characters, and arrays in the COC Input file are read using free format.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Required comment line —“#” must be in column 1.
Required comment line —“#” must be in column 1.

para.text: NNODES—is an integer number equal to the number of nodes for which flow and head values are desired in separate output files.
Required comment line —“#” must be in column 1.

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

toggle.caption: Explanation of Variables

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: NODE_NUMBERS—are integer values of the node numbers for which flow and head values are desired in separate output files. List one node number per line.
Required comment line —“#” must be in column 1.

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

toggle.caption: Explanation of Variables

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: N_NTS—is an integer value equal to the time step interval for output of node head and flow values. As an example, N_NTS equal to 2 activates node output at each NODE_NUMBERS every 2 time steps.
Required comment line —“#” must be in column 1.

para.text: NPIPES—is an integer value equal to the number of pipes for which flow rates and Reynolds numbers are desired in separate output files.
Required comment line —“#” must be in column 1.

para.text: PIPE_NUMBERS—are integer values of the pipe numbers for which flow and head values are desired in separate output files. List one pipe number per line.
Required comment line —“#” must be in column 1.

para.text: T_NTS—is an integer value equal to the time step interval for output of pipe flow rates and Reynolds num­bers. As an example, T_NTS equal to 2 activates node output at each PIPE_NUMBERS every 2 time steps.
